reviews.text: Really nice place, with interesting modern design blended with a traditional country house atmosphere. Great location, Virginia Water and Windsor Park nearby for scenic walks. Lovely room, great bedding. Restaurant at main house was great too, lovely ambiance, good food. Purpose built spa is wonderful. Staff are very helpful and friendly, service levels that you don't often find in the UK.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: Two minor quibbles. Breakfast could have been better in my opinion - tea and smoked salmon weren't to my taste, would generally prefer a buffet style. Secondly, spa did not have a sauna.
reviews.title: So elegant

reviews.text: Generally a wonderful break, especially for Londoners, as it is very close to London, yet quiet and scenic. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Amazing comfort, luxury, service and setting.
Style over substance
reviews.text: Me and my husband spent the weekend at Coworth Park and it was unforgetable. The staff is very nice and our room was the most beautiful. They have bikes to ride and a very nice heated pool. A wonderful place to relax. The restaurant is very fancy and expensive , but there's a more informal choice, at the Barn.

reviews.title: Dinner
reviews.text: Just finished stating at the Coworth Park or the 2nd time in 12 months. This is simply one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

reviews.title: Stunning Luxury Hotel with Excellent Service
reviews.text: Booked a Birthday treat for my wife's birthday and got an upgrade to one of the Stable Cottages - a fantastic duplex room and real treat for us both. Room amenities were fantastic and everything has been finished to a very high standard - one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in.

reviews.title: Lovely ambiance
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are great to explore and with the attached stables, you can explore these on horseback which makes for a really different experience to other locations. They also have bicycles available for riding around the grounds and local area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff we encountered were delightful and went out of their way to look after us - what you would expect, but so lovely to actually have people that seemed to enjoy doing their jobs.
reviews.title: Recent stay at Coworth Park

reviews.text: The food we had at the Barn Restaurant was excellent although we would have loved to dine in the main restaurant which was closed on the night we were there. Even the Spatisserie in the Spa served lovely food during a relaxing few hours away from the hustle and bustle.
reviews.title: A Great Escape

reviews.text: Overall, we both had a lovely time and would have loved to stay longer
reviews.title: An exceptional hotel
Afternoon tea -Christian and Gerard
reviews.text: I book for the 2nd time for Aft tea about 30 minutes before showing up... Like before an amazing welcome to the hotel... Afternoon tea I think is top notch however the let it down a little bit... Christian our server really is an Asset to your team... Amazing at his job and really really should and I do hope will go far within the Dorchester chain and coworth park itself... Gerard a doorman was also wondering too me and my friend Hannah a trip around the grounds on a golf buggy showing us EVERYWHERE... Working in Four Seasons and in f&b me And my friend really did find our spontaneous afternoon tea trip very beneficial and amazing!! I would LOVE to return and cannot wait too... I've been talking about it ever since!!

Brilliant staff who looked after us from check in to departure , however the food and service lacking. E odered fo 6 Feathered feast Sunday lunch £60 a head, however this was available as ordered so we went for the Sunday lunch menu £39.95 but we were okay with that,the beef was tender but dry ( could have been under heat light for a long time) we had to wait 10 mins for one well done beef to be served so the other 5 had to start as the food was getting cold. Breakfast another dissapointment Kippers overcooked, bacon dry, eggs benedict cold and all served on a cold plate., no fresh fruit. The swimming pool was great at the Spa very well run. the rooms were very comfotable with a great comfy bed and superb linen. At £295 + vat I would have expected the food to be at a high standard to match the venue and staff, we were dissapointed that lunch and breakfast spoilt the occasion.I have given it 4 stars as perhaps dinner might be better but watch the breakfasts.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, food was not up to the same standard. Limited Wi-Fi time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 17th century building that has been completely refurbished with the exterior maintaining the beautiful architecture and inside completely updated in a contemporary manner. Staff very attentive and polite, the whole building spotless and set in wonderful grounds that includes a polo park, tennis courts, nice gardens and a detached spa and gym. Good selection of breakfast food served by waiters, not a buffet, and of a good quality and too much quantity for us. Two restaurants, one informal, nice bar area. Great location for a special weekend. Spa is smallish with pool, steam room and gym and plenty of beds around the pool.
reviews.title: One night stay with spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much searching and deliberating between varying options I decided to stay at Coworth park to surprise and then propose to my girlfriend (she said yes!!)
reviews.title: Amazing grounds, amazing staff, amazing time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My decision to stay at Coworth was very much based on all the glowing reviews I read here. They couldn't have been more accurate!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
Beautiful cakes and views
reviews.text: Stopped off on the way home one evening after being refused service in Westfield because the cafes there were closing in 5 minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a couple of well made cocktails and wanting cakes was offered the cake selection from the afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Pure Luxy in country style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Views over the meadow were fantastic with it being in full bloom though I wonder how it'll be when the wild flowers have died back. The service was very good and polite but on occasions a tiny bit slow.
reviews.title: Pure Luxury

reviews.text: The only negative I'd have would be with some of the other guests, as we were the only ones there that day in jeans/ smart casual rather than more formal attire and had a few looks from some others. Not a single look or comment out of place from the staff though.
reviews.title: Absolute unadulterated bliss!

reviews.text: This is the best Hotel I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in many 5 star Hotels and this is definitely the best. From the point you enter the private estate till you reach your room. It is pure luxury and a feast for the eyes. The rooms are very spacious and simply beautiful. The estate is great for walks. They have a tennis court and their own horses for use by the guests. They also have a nice selection of quality British made bicycles which can be rented free of charge. The restaurant inside the main house served some of the best food I ever ate. Overall this has been an experience which I will never forget. I can recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a relaxed and luxurious stay outside the city.
reviews.title: Book without any hesitation
